Package architecture

Class Equation

  • java.lang.Object
    • architecture.Equation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    P, java.io.Serializable

    public class Equation
extends java.lang.Object
implements P, java.io.Serializable
    Objects that represent equations as in a=b, a<b, etc.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Equation.Relation
      Type of relations between two terms like equality or less than.
      static class  Equation.Type
      Type of equations: simple relations like 'a=b', or conjunctions like 'a=b and c<d'.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Equation

        public Equation​(java.lang.String name,
                Equation.Type type,
                Equation.Relation rel,
                Term op1,
                Term op2,
                Equation eq1,
                Equation eq2)
        The full constructor for an equation typically only called within this class by the specific constructors.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the equation
        type - the type of equation: relation / conjunction
        rel - the explicit relation
        op1 - the left-hand side of the relation
        op2 - the right-hand side of the relation
        eq1 - the first equation
        eq2 - the second equation

      • isComplex

        public boolean isComplex​()
        Checks if the equation is complex.
        Returns:
        true, if the equation has depth greater than 3

      • match2

        public java.util.Set<Equation> match2​(Equation pattern)
        Method for pattern matching equations, recursive version, using Term.match() method
        Parameters:
        pattern - pattern equation, e.g. x=h(y)
        Returns:
        a list of equations representing the matches, e.g. x=cp, y=p

      • isReflexive

        public boolean isReflexive​()
        Check if this equation is reflexive, i.e., op1 = op2.
        Returns:
        true, if the equation is of the form x = x
